Format: transform(string.begin(), string.end(), result.begin(), ::tolower)The transform function exists in the std:: namespace. You must include the  header file to use it. The tolower and toupper functions are in the global namespace, obtained by the  header file. The std::tolower and std::toupper names are overloaded and cannot be passed to std::transform without a cast to resolve a function overloading ambiguity, e.g. std::transform(string.begin(), string.end(), result.begin(), (int (*)(int))std::tolower),
Languages: C++std::string only, result is stored in string result which is at least as long as string, and may or may not be string itself
Rubyonly ASCII characters as Ruby lacks Unicode support
